messages.subject: [AlwaysLearning] Evolution/Religion/Faith (was Teenage Issues)
messages.msgSnippet: ... I believe this too, and obviously I am a very spiritual person.  Evolution is a natural force and as much a part of my faith and spirituality as the
messages.messageBody:
>Evolution is a powerful force. More powerful than
>God, unaffected by prayer, promises you
>nothing in return for your belief except maybe the
>idea you have as good a chance at life as the common
>ground beetle does. Or that cat on your
>lap. It's humbling when you stop thinking of
>yourself as Godlike.

I believe this too, and obviously I am a very
spiritual person. Evolution is a natural force and as
much a part of my faith and spirituality as the
evolution of the soul or the evolution of the human
being from birth to death both physically and
emotionally/intellectually. All natural forces are a
part of the great web that includes all life and my
higher power.

>What do you think? My sister in law believes in a
>higher power, a universal force

>(Luke, Luke...)

LOL

>for good or evil as we choose to use it.
>Deb L

I believe this too, and my universal force is that
universal higher power, which is both male and female
and not sexed or human at all. I can be very specific
in ritual and worship in directing my energies in
thoughform towards a specific embodiment of energies
and ideas that is a particular "persona" of my higher
power, but they are all essentially different facets
of the same spectrum, different faces in the mirror.
It matters not what you call your Higher Power, even
if your Higher Power is the strength within yourself
that allows you to defend your principles and beliefs
and feel your connection to all living things.

Nanci K.
